contentrichtext.text: '''Buno''' ("to throw" in [[Tagalog language|Tagalog]].<ref>[http://www.bohol.ph/diksyunaryo.php?sw=buno&lang=Cebuano&sid=d5582b9f50a02b808066f22d239538bb Philippine Online Dictionary]</ref>) is a system of [[Philippines|Filipino]] [[Sport wrestling|wrestling]] like [[Dumog]]. Harimaw Buno, formerly Harimaw Lumad (King of Tiger Wrestling), is a style of Buno used by the [[Mangyan]]s of [[Mindoro]] and the [[Aeta]]s of [[Infanta, Quezon]].<ref name="hari">[http://www.garimot.com/system/buno-intro.htm Harimaw Buno]</ref> Buno usually uses standing throws, control locks, joint manipulation, striking, take-downs and ground wrestling techniques,<ref name="book">[http://www.filipinofightingartsintl.com/Publications/martial_arts/fma_books.html Books About Filipino Martial Arts You Should Have In Your Library]</ref> There is also an armed style of Buno. Weapons that the practitioner can use are knives, spears and bow and arrows. The main weapon used is the ''lubid'' or a four-feet long rope.<ref name="hari"/> Training utilizes mud training, canoe training, [[tamaraw]] wrestling, log training and tree climbing.<ref name="book"/> ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==Other External Links== *[http://www.tipunan.com/Publications/martial_arts/harimaw-buno.html The Tipunan Group] *[http://www.kali-silat.com NorthStorm] {{Folk wrestling}} [[Category:Philippine martial arts]] [[Category:Eskrima]] [[Category:Folk wrestling styles]] {{martialart-stub}}
